Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Sense \Sense\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Sensed}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Sensing}.] To perceive by the senses; to recognize. [Obs. or Colloq.] [1913 Webster]
Is he sure that objects are not otherwise sensed by others than they are by him? --Glanvill. [1913 Webster]

sensing n 1: the perception that something has occurred or some state exists; "early detection can often lead to a cure" [syn: {detection}] 2: becoming aware of something via the senses [syn: {perception}]
